alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 14 at 3:04AM MDT until April 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS AND THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Another round of critical fire weather conditions is expected to return today across much of eastern New Mexico. Winds will re- strengthen through the late morning and early afternoon with another round of low humidity. Critical fire weather conditions may redevelop Saturday across portions of central and east central New Mexico as stronger northwest winds persist behind a cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Central Highlands (Zone 125) from noon to 8 pm MDT today for the warning and from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon for the watch. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph today. Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to near 45 mph Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 11 to 16 percent this afternoon and 9 to 14 percent Saturday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.
